result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Remington Joseph Burage

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Remington Joseph Burage appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke appeared by video for Remington Joseph Burage.  Prosecuting Attorney Kaylan Reilly in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court took judicial notice of 16cf4402.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer K. Labensky. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Remington Joseph Burage appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke appeared by video for Remington Joseph Burage.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Order to Show Cause hearing. Attorney Wineke was recently appointed by the Public Defender's Office. Discussion placed on the record. Court reviewed Defendant's Motion to Dismiss; however, Court advised Defendant that a Motion hearing should not have been scheduled due to the fact that he did not have counsel until yesterday (October 18, 2022). Court REINSTATED TIME LIMITS. Case adjourned for Preliminary hearing, Branch PE. Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:30 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

*Clerk made arrangements with DCI for Defendant to appear via Zoom for Prelim hearing.
DEFENDANT APPEARING VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.

Due to DCI availability, Order to Show Cause hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference. 
Information provided to DA's OTP Clerk and Public Defender's Office.

Defendant Remington Joseph Burage appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. SPD has not appointed counsel. Mr Burage has filed a motion that will be addressed in the trial court in addition to a State V. Lee hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to Br 46.
Motion hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss.  (Remington J. Burage - #2022009948, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Correspondence dated August 30, 2022 from the Public Defender's Office regarding appoint of counsel; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Remington Joseph Burage not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness was present. SPD failed to appoint counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with J.R.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Remington Joseph Burage in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Remington Joseph Burage in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Remington Joseph Burage appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K WARRANT
